time_based_exposures.methodology_note: ONE_TIME: face value; MULTI_YEAR: DCF at 8%; PERPETUAL: NPV = Annual / 0.08

pairs_adjusted.rationale: NPDES downside triggers premature shutdown causing NDT shortfall - correlated causation
Both contingent on seller cooperation for Section 754 election - near-perfect correlation

escrow_analysis.calculation_basis: Three-tier structure: NDT/Environmental ($300M) + Regulatory Approval ($150M) + General Indemnification ($50M)
escrow_analysis.largest_exposure_note: Price-Anderson $275.2M max assessment has <1% probability; escrow sized for high-probability risks
adequacy_flags: NDT/NPDES tail risks ($3.3B combined) only 15% covered - buyer bears majority of tail risk
Tier 1 release tied to NPDES 2028 permit renewal - aligned with risk timeline

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Price-Anderson retrospective premium assessment ($275.2M max over 7 years, <1% annual probability)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Triggered by nuclear incident at any U.S. reactor exceeding $900M ANI/NEIL primary insurance

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: DOE Phase II spent fuel damages recovery ($120M-$180M range, mean $150M, 90-95% probability of award)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Trial Q3 2026, judgment Q4 2026-Q1 2027, recovery flows to APH post-closing

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: NDT premature shutdown shortfall ($485M-$1.0B range, mean $742.5M, 20-30% probability if shutdown before 2035)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Post-2035 PPA expiration, triggered by unfavorable merchant market economics
findings_by_domain.correlation_note: Correlated with NPDES permit renewal outcomes (rho=0.65)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: NPDES permit renewal downside scenarios (27.5% prob $50M-$200M capex; 3.5% prob $1.8B-$3.0B cooling tower retrofit; 5.5% prob denial/shutdown)
findings_by_domain.timeline: 2028 permit renewal decision, construction 2028-2029 if modifications required
findings_by_domain.tail_risk_note: 9.0% probability of deal-blocking outcomes (cooling tower retrofit or permit denial)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Dry cask storage annual costs ($8M-$12M, mean $10M annually for 50 years, PV $180M-$220M @ 6% WACC)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Ongoing annual costs 2025-2075, escalating 2.5% annually, offset by DOE Phase II recovery for 2014-2024
findings_by_domain.offset_note: DOE Phase II recovery ($120M-$180M) offsets 60-100% of PV exposure

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Property damage class action settlement ($2M-$5M range, mean $3.5M, 60-70% probability)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Trial Q2 2026, likely pre-trial settlement Q1 2026

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Peterson v. GLNPC age discrimination individual case ($1M-$1.2M, mean $1.15M, 50-70% settlement probability)
Peterson class action if certified ($8M-$15M range, mean $11.5M, 40-50% certification probability)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Class certification hearing Q4 2026, if certified trial Q1-Q2 2027

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: WARN Act violation exposure ($1.8M-$2.0M for 100-employee RIF scenario, mean $1.9M, 60-70% probability if APH executes post-closing workforce optimization)
10 CFR 73.56 access authorization re-verification ($6.29M-$12.86M range for 1,850 employees, mean $9.575M, 20-30% probability required)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Post-closing if NRC determines foreign ownership change requires re-verification

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: NRC Section 184 license transfer application costs ($2.5M-$4.0M, mean $3.25M, 100% probability)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Application filing within 30 days post-signing, 12-18 month approval timeline, 75-80% approval probability

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: SNM-1872 license transfer 10 CFR 70.32 costs (PIV $575K @ 75% prob + MC&A retention $365K + enhanced safeguards $1.5M PV @ 67.5% prob = $2.39M expected)
findings_by_domain.timeline: 14-month approval timeline concurrent with Section 184 application, separate NRC approval required

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Negation Action Plan (NAP) implementation and 10-year compliance costs ($2.0M-$4.5M, mean $3.25M PV @ 6%, 100% probability given QIA 20% + CPPIB 25% = 45% foreign ownership)
findings_by_domain.timeline: NAP drafted pre-filing, implemented at closing, annual compliance audits for 10 years

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Key personnel retention bonuses for SROs ($2.5M-$4.0M, mean $3.25M over 3-5 years, 100% probability - DEAL-BLOCKING if not executed)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Retention agreements executed pre-closing, payments over 24-60 months
findings_by_domain.criticality_note: Without SRO retention, 40-60% voluntary departure probability triggers 70-80% NRC license denial risk

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: NIEC PPA renegotiation risk ($42/MWh reduced to $38-$40/MWh = $78M-$98M annual revenue loss, mean $88M, 15% probability if consent withheld)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Change of control consent required at closing, renegotiation risk if NIEC demands concessions
findings_by_domain.npv_calculation: $88M annual / 0.08 discount = $1.1B NPV; capped at 15-year PPA remaining term = $1.32B PV

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: IRC Section 338(h)(10) election tax benefit ($1.0B-$1.06B NPV, mean $1.03B over 15-20 years @ 7% discount, 90-95% probability contingent on seller cooperation)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Election filed within 75 days of closing, stepped-up basis depreciation realized over 15-20 years
findings_by_domain.offset_note: Requires $100M-$200M gross-up payment to seller (mean $150M) to compensate seller's tax liability

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Tax gross-up payment to seller for Section 338 election ($100M-$200M, mean $150M, 90-95% probability - correlates with Section 754 benefit)
findings_by_domain.timeline: Negotiated purchase price adjustment paid at closing
findings_by_domain.correlation_note: 95% correlated with IRC Section 338 benefit - both contingent on seller cooperation

top_10_exposures.finding: Retrospective premium assessment for nuclear incident
top_10_exposures.note: Zero historical assessments since 1957; material EBITDA impact (5.7%) if triggered

top_10_exposures.finding: Permit renewal downside scenarios (cooling tower retrofit or denial)
top_10_exposures.note: 9.0% tail risk probability of deal-blocking outcomes; 2028 decision timeline
Largest favorable exposure; 15-20 year NPV from stepped-up basis depreciation
Correlated with NPDES and PPA expiration risks; post-2035 merchant market exposure
50-year PV of $10M annual costs; 60-100% offset by DOE Phase II recovery
High-probability recovery; trial Q3 2026; compensates 2014-2024 dry cask costs
Negotiated purchase price adjustment; 30-75% of seller's $252M-$357M tax cost
15-year NPV of $88M annual revenue reduction if consent withheld
35 potential plaintiffs if class certified Q4 2026; $8M-$15M settlement range
20-30% probability NRC requires re-verification due to foreign ownership change

purchase_price_recommendation.rationale: Probability-weighted EV of +$636.7M supports transaction value; $50M discount accounts for 10% P10 tail risk ($4.515B downside) offset by 25% P75+ upside ($949M-$1.15B); negotiated risk allocation split 75/25 (seller escrow $500M, buyer accepts $50M headline reduction)
purchase_price_recommendation.market_comparison: 10-15% discount to comparable nuclear transactions ($1,896-$3,906/kW range); justified by foreign ownership NRC risk + NPDES tail risk + 2035 merchant market cliff

conditions: $50M purchase price reduction to $3.15B (1.56% discount from $3.2B ask)
$500M three-tier escrow structure (Tier 1: $300M NDT/Environmental 36mo; Tier 2: $150M Regulatory 24mo; Tier 3: $50M General 18mo)
Parent/seller guarantee for NDT shortfalls exceeding $300M if premature shutdown before 2032
IRC Section 338(h)(10) election mandatory closing condition; $150M gross-up to seller
DOE Phase II recovery ($120M-$180M expected award) flows 100% to APH post-closing
NPDES permit renewal application filed pre-closing; EPA informal indication of likely approval
Management retention agreements executed for CNO, Plant Manager, Operations Manager (all SROs) with minimum 24-month terms
Material Adverse Effect (MAE) clause: NPDES permit denial or NRC license denial constitutes MAE allowing buyer termination
investment_committee_recommendation.expected_value_analysis: P50 (median) outcome +$803.3M net favorable; probability-weighted EV across all scenarios +$636.7M; 70% probability of favorable outcome offsets 10% probability of severe downside

scenarios.impact: Forced plant shutdown, asset worthless, $3.2B+ total loss
scenarios.mitigation: Closing condition: EPA informal pre-approval indication; Material Adverse Effect clause

scenarios.impact: Transaction cannot close, breakup fee exposure, $150M+ sunk transaction costs
scenarios.mitigation: Pre-filing meetings with NRC; demonstrate QIA passive investor status; robust NAP addressing Section 103d concerns

scenarios.impact: $1.8B-$3.0B capital expenditure rendering economics unfavorable, effective deal-blocking
scenarios.mitigation: Environmental consultant pre-assessment; $300M Tier 1 escrow provides 12.5% partial coverage

scenarios.scenario: IRC Section 338 election refusal by seller
scenarios.impact: Buyer loses $1.0B-$1.06B NPV tax benefit, transaction IRR falls below 12% hurdle
scenarios.mitigation: Make Section 338 election mandatory closing condition; $150M gross-up incentivizes seller cooperation

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst probability estimates based on: (1) regulatory approval historical precedents; (2) litigation settlement benchmarks; (3) industry engineering risk assessments (NPDES/NDT); (4) tax planning certainty levels; (5) employment law case outcome statistics
quantification_methodology.correlation_methodology: Identified mechanical/causal correlations: (1) NPDES ↔ NDT (rho=0.65) via premature shutdown causation; (2) Section 338 ↔ Gross-up (rho=0.95) via seller cooperation dependency
quantification_methodology.monte_carlo_validation: T15 financial-impact-analysis conducted 1,000-iteration Monte Carlo simulation with triangular/normal/Bernoulli distributions; percentile results (P10/P25/P50/P75/P90) validated against expected value calculations

key_risk_drivers: NDT premature shutdown shortfall: $187M expected (30% probability × $485M-$900M range)
Dry cask storage lifecycle: $200M PV (100% probability, offset by DOE recovery)
NPDES permit renewal: $98M expected (31% downside probability, 9% tail risk deal-blocking)
top_deal_risks: NPDES permit denial (5.5% probability) - deal-blocking, $3.2B loss
NRC license denial (20% probability) - deal-blocking, $150M+ sunk costs
Section 338 refusal (7.5% probability) - loses $1.0B NPV, IRR below hurdle
NDT shortfall + NPDES downside (correlated 20% probability) - $610M-$1.1B combined
executive_summary_inputs.escrow_summary: $500M three-tier structure with staggered 18/24/36-month releases tied to risk resolution milestones
executive_summary_inputs.purchase_price_summary: $3.15B recommended (1.56% discount); $1,703/kW implies 10-15% discount to market; justified by tail risks
